subject: Parenting
title: Intrinsic vs Extrinsic Motivation
description: A micro-lesson that makes Intrinsic vs Extrinsic Motivation usable.

hook.text: A child reads for fun every night. You start paying her per book. She stops reading for fun.

buildup.text: Intrinsic motivation comes from within â€” curiosity, enjoyment, satisfaction.

discovery.text: Extrinsic rewards â€” money, stickers, grades â€” can undermine the internal drive they're meant to support.

twist.text: This is called the overjustification effect: external rewards replace internal ones.

climax.text: Children who are intrinsically motivated persist longer, learn deeper, and enjoy the process more.

punchline.text: Pay a child to read and she reads for money, not joy.
